definition: to make a story or theory consistent/to give a plausible explanation/to plug the holes in one's story
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
circle/round/circular/spherical/(of the moon) full/unit of Chinese currency (yuan)/tactful/to make consistent and whole (the narrative of a dream or a lie)
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: Rowling will have to think up something clever for this one.
sentences.chinese: 羅琳必須想一個高明的籍口才能自圓其說。

sentences.english: Does he have a way out of it?
Otherwise if, hard to avoid has justify oneself , the ill will of exaggerated absurd argument.
sentences.chinese: 否則的話，難免有自圓其說，誇大奇談之嫌。
這些模型在理論上能夠自圓其說。

sentences.english: Some are apparently hiding in plain sight.
sentences.chinese: 一些報道顯然是在自圓其說。

definition: to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
complete nonsense (idiom)
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
misconception/fallacy
to become a mere formality
specious arguments/sophistry
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
to dispute/to refute
to judge
to criticize (as a matter of principle)
to play deaf-mute
sequel/continuation of a book
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
